text: here's a recipe I think you'll really
love and it's great for a weekend it
does take a little bit of time but it
doesn't take that much work it's a
roasted pork shoulder with a fennel and
rosemary rub and I think you guys are
gonna really really love it so to start
off with what you want to do is make a
paste take two tablespoons of olive oil
and put it into a food processor 1 to 8
cloves of garlic 3 tablespoons of
rosemary leaves 2 tablespoons of fennel
seeds 2 teaspoons of coarse salt and a
teaspoon of black pepper this is a
really really flavorful rub that you put
all over the outside of your pork
shoulder and then you slow roast it
until the pork is falling apart and
tender and so delicious just want to
grind everything up to a paste
that's my paste I have a four pound pork
roast here this is a pork shoulder it
has a lot of like internal fat and a
little coating of outer fat and all of
that as it's cooking sort of breaks down
and it becomes very very tender and
delicious
you can't cook quickly though because
everything will seize up and then it'll
be tough it takes a long time for those
fibers to break down and become tender
poke it all over with the tip of a
paring knife this will allow some of the
pace to get inside of the pork flavors
of fennel and rosemary are so good
together they're kind of like the inside
of a porchetta if you've ever had a
porchetta you ever been lucky enough to
travel to Italy they do pork roasts with
all these amazing fragrant
ingredients like this have your oven
preheating to 450 degrees so it gets
nice and hot Brown the pork when you put
it in so just take your twine slip it
underneath there are fancier ways of
doing this that butchers use but I
always just cut pieces that are big
enough to go around my roast and then
tie them I don't like to cover up too
much of my roast with twine I just want
it nice and compact so then just
transfer your pork to an oiled roasting
pan get this right into your 450 degree
oven and roast it for 30 minutes then
reduce the temperature to 300 degrees
and continue roasting until it's 170
degrees in the thickest part that'll
take about two-and-a-half hours and my
pork resting over here attended with
foil to keep warm and that also allows
the juices to redistribute and I'm gonna
make my sauce right in this roasting pan
which is the advantage of making
something in a nice heavy pan because
you can put it right on top of the stove
to make a sauce to the pan you can add a
half a cup of dry white wine to deglaze
get all those brown bits up from the
bottom of the pan that's gonna make a
delicious sauce I love to incorporate
every bit of flavor that I can and
scraping up these brown bits from the
bottom of the roasting pan
really do that want to cook off the
alcohol in the wine or at least most of
the alcohol and the wine so cook this
for a few minutes and it'll reduce down
a little bit as well
this is already looking like a nice rich
sauce but I don't want just wine in my
sauce and I want to give it a little bit
of thickener so I'm adding a tablespoon
of flour you can whisk that in so it
doesn't get lumpy and then add one and a
half cups of chicken broth whisk it in
vigorously I see that I missed a couple
of pieces of that flour and it did get a
little bit lumpy I will remove those or
strain them out afterwards or if I'm
lucky my vigorous whisking will get rid
of them you're not looking for anything
too thick here just a nice sort of
lightly thickened gravy give it a taste
you might need to season it but remember
your rub was already seasoned so there's
gonna be some salt already in there mmm
that's great okay so now carve the pork
uncover fennel and pork is one of my
favorite flavors we add rosemary forget
about it it should be nice and tender
you can slice it nice and thinly as well
slice it up get it on a platter but
before you do that give it a taste
because you're not gonna believe it
no you are gonna believe it I'm here to
tell you that it is fantastic
hmm you're not going to be able to stop
eating it the great thing about it is
it's a nice big roast so you can make
sandwiches with it tomorrow
you
you
